p: Cyclooxygenases (COX), known as prostaglandin H 2 synthases, catalyze the first phase in the biosynthesis of the Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drugs (NSAIDs) prostaglandins (PGs) and thromboxanes [ 37]. Most of the commonly used NSAIDs have various harmful side effects including ringing in the ear, heartburn, stomach pain, hemorrhage, dizziness, headaches, allergic reactions, kidney or liver problems, hyperglycemia, and high blood pressure [ 38].
